item.description:
As promised, I have rescheduled this event. I already have my ticket for the 4:15 p.m. show. I strongly advise you to purchase your tickets before the day of the event. The theater's website has a link called "Tickets" near the top of its homepage.

Spielberg’s movie Lincoln is based in part on the book Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln by Doris Kearns Goodwin. What a great read! I’m looking forward to seeing how Spielberg’s adaptation fares on the big screen. And I want to see David Strathairn as Secretary of State Seward (yeah, that one: Seward’s Folly).

*****From the theater website:
Steven Spielberg directs two-time Academy Award winner Daniel Day-Lewis (There Will Be Blood, My Left Foot) in Lincoln, a revealing drama that focuses on the sixteenth president's tumultuous final months in office. In a nation divided by war and the strong winds of change, Lincoln pursues a course of action designed to end the war, unite the country and abolish slavery. With the moral courage and fierce determination to succeed, his choices during this critical moment will change the fate of generations to come. Also starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Tommy Lee Jones, Sally Field and David Strathairn.
*****

I will arrive at the theater at 3:30 p.m. and wait at the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby. Look for me carrying a red backpack. I strongly suggest buying your ticket online or arriving early to buy it. The movie starts at 4:15 p.m.

At about 3:45, I will move into the theater auditorium so we can get seats (and I can’t miss the previews!). You can find me in the theater auditorium if you are late. Arrive early if you want to sit with the group, or if you want to sit with me in the front of the auditorium.

After the movie, I will wait at the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby to gather everyone. Look for the red backpack. We can chat briefly about the movie then.

Going out after the movie is optional and will be decided by the group after the movie. >>If<< we decide to go out after the movie, be prepared to add 25% to the cost of your order for both tax and tip. Restaurants in the area add the gratuity to the check automatically for large groups. Bring CASH to make division of the check easier.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this event so I know who to look for.

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the red backpack. See the event description for complete details.
